title: Onscreen Keyboard
content: How do I stop the onscreen keyboard popping up?
creator: kerry18

title: Amazon customer images
content: Today when I started up, I got a notice from Mozilla about a 'new' feature for Pocket. I already use Pocket frequently, so I figured, why not? I said 'OK" (or whatever it was, it was too fast to really remember). Then it wanted to sign me in using what I suppose is my Firefox login (using my Google credential). Well, when I was logged in, I realized the my Google credentials are not what I used to sign into Pocket, since there were no saved items. So, I logged out, and then logged in using my original credentials. Everything was there. OK. Or so I thought. Now, when I go to Amazon pages, I cannot view the customer images in the reviews. If I click on one, I get a very tiny popup that I can't read (because the full text cannot be displayed in this tiny box). If I click on the popup, all I get is an 'x' to close the box. Then if I click on that, the popup disappears and I still can't view the customer images. I don't know how those two could be related, but your Pocket link is the only thing that has changed in this regard. I used to have the Pocket Add In that I used, but that has disappeared from my toolbar. I want to go back to my old add in. And I want to be able to view the customer images on Amazon.
creator: GaijinSue1

title: Unable to change from UTC time
content:
I need some help as I can't seem to reset the timezone of my Firefox browser. Currently it is showing as UTC.

From the console it shows this

new Date() Date Fri Aug 13 2021 00:02:50 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time)

I've checked about:config and confirmed privacy.resistFingerprinting is set to false.

OS: Windows 10 v21H1 Firefox: 90.0.2 (64-bit)

I've checked the regional settings in Windows and confirmed they are set to my timezone and formats are all correct. So I am racking my brain trying to workout why I can't fix the issue.
creator: matt100

title: Firefox UI
content: I get you want to make firefox look bold and new but i don't know of ANYONE who likes the bold new looks. we use firefox because of how it DID look. not for how you want it to look. i am all for adding ability to apps but PLEASE give us the ability to keep the look and features we love!!!!!!!!
creator: iccor56
